snippet: The fact that the suspect in the murder of Tom Clements, the head of Colorado’s prison system, is dead has left investigators with more questions than answers.
abstract: Death of Evan S Ebel, prime suspect in murder of Colorado prison system head Tom Clements, has left investigators uncertain whether murder was gang-ordered hit or act of lone gunman whose years in solitary confinement may have nurtured paranoia and hatred of prison officials; search is continuing for James Lohr and Thomas Guolee, members of 211 Crew gang who are known to have had recent contact with Ebel.

byline.original: By ERICA GOODE and DAN FROSCH

lead_paragraph: The fact that the suspect in the murder of Tom Clements, the head of Colorado’s prison system, is dead has left investigators with more questions than answers.

headline.seo: Mysteries Multiply in Tom Clements’s Killing
headline.main: Mysteries Multiply in Prison Chief’s Killing
headline.print_headline: Weeks After Prison Chief’s Killing, a Dead Suspect and Many Questions
